seed.name: Libertas
seed.high_concept:
An isolated, libertarian society in the near (100 years) future. 
Society is highly stratified.
Most people have cybernetic enhancements, some of which are absolutely necessay for daily life.
Pollution and climate change has rendered indoor spaces more valuable than outdoor spaces.
A handful of corporations have a weak grip on the city. Formal governments have largely collapsed.
Large portions of the city are illegal, ramshackle "open blocks" which resemble Kowloon Walled City.
Crime that does not damage corporations' property or employees is tolerated when convenient.

technologies.name: Merged
technologies.description: A mix of many languages. It is spoken using translation and transliteration implants. Common is the only remaining language that is taught formally.
technologies.impact: Merged is the default language of the city. It is a mix of many languages, and is spoken by almost everyone. It is the default language for almost all communication.
technologies.limitations: If your translation implant is disabled or damaged, you can't speak or understand others. Because the implant is inside of the brain, this is rare, except in cases that would have already been fatal. Phobos natives won't understand you, and it's unlikely that people from outside Libertas will, either.

technologies.name: Common
technologies.description: The only remaining language that is taught formally. Only Phobos citizens speak it. It is a mix of Latin and Greek, with a rhythmic cadence of syllables that sounds reminiscient of Korean.
technologies.impact: Phobos's primary language, which they are intentionally cliquey and exlcusionary with. Most people have no reason to speak or learn Common, so those that do can sometimes understand their surroundings better.
technologies.limitations: Common is inherently exclusive, and Phobos uses it to keep outsiders out. It is also a very difficult language to learn, and most people don't bother.

technologies.name: Translation Implants
technologies.description: Implants that allow you to translate and transliterate languages. They do not allow you to speak Common. Almost everyone in Libertas has a translation implant, and as a result language has become almost unrecognizable. Everyone just uses 'Merged' for shorthand.
technologies.impact: Almost everyone in Libertas speaks Merged, a language that emerged as a result of everyone having these implants. As a result, speech is impossible without it.
technologies.limitations: If the implant is disabled or damaged, the user can't speak or understand others. Because the implant is inside of the brain, this is rare, except in cases that would have already been fatal. The translation implant does NOT allow the user to speak Common, which must be learned the old fashioned way.

technologies.name: Implant Sickness
technologies.description: Implants can cause a variety of symptoms, including but not limited to: nausea, dizziness, confusion, hallucinations, coma, and death. A drug called PHQ-9, often referred to on the street as 'Jolt' reverses the implant sickness, but only temporarily.
technologies.impact: Implant sickness is dreaded, but common. Most cases are treatable. Rarely, someone becomes 'broken', a slang term for someone whose implants have failed entirely.
technologies.limitations: Implant sickness can be mitigated with treatments fairly easily. A 'technician', or implant specialist, can remove the damaged connections and/or replace implants as needed.

technologies.name: Jolt / PHQ-9
technologies.description: A drug manufactured by Vextros that reverses the symptoms of implant sickness. It's often dispensed by autoinjectors that accept pink cartridges. It is often referred to on the street as 'Jolt'.  Each successive use of PHQ-9 becomes less effective. PHQ-9 also causes euphoria and sedation, in a manner similar to ketamine.
technologies.impact: PHQ-9 treats implant sickness, which occurs often especially with lower quality implants. 'Jolt' dens litter the city, not because of implant sickness, but because the drug also causes intense euphoria.
technologies.limitations: PHQ-9 is addictive, and each successive use of PHQ-9 becomes less effective. It's also manufactured solely by Vextros, and they could hypothetically withhold their supply.

technologies.name: Nutrax
technologies.description: A meal replacement made by Vextros. It comes in a wide variety of flavors and consistencies, and is created by reprocessing minerals and nitrogen found through the city's mining operations. Pure Nutrax is actually pretty good, but most of the time it's been adulterated, usually by Vextros itself. Vextros adds everything from sawdust to pharmaceuticals they feel like testing.
technologies.impact: Nutrax is a strict necessity for some parts of the population because it's often very affordable.
technologies.limitations: Nutrax is often adulterated, and can cause nutritional deficiencies and malnutrition.

factions.name: Vextros
factions.ideology: Essentially a corporation that has grown to be the size of a government. Believes that they are entitled to a say in almost all matters. Prioritizes order to justice whenever such a choice presents itself.

factions.name: The Open Blocks
factions.ideology: Anarchistic, anti-corporate, and anti-authoritarian. Violence is seen as morally good if it is used to protect the community. It is understood that every open block may follow very different rules, and their ability to remain organized depends on their consent to be self-governing. Tyrannical or dysfunctional open blocks are often rooted out by groups of residents.

factions.name: Project Sunset

relationships.Alan Carlsile: enemy. Alan hates Sunset, partially for causing Scramble, partially because he believes Regina died as a result of her arrogance. He views Sunset as a threat to the sentience of humans. Alan artificially extended his life for as long as possible to try and find a way to undo what Regina did.

factions.internal_hint: The player, or a significant NPC, might become the ADMINISTRATOR.

districts.description: The Akropolis is an underground city built inside a cave system. It is a far-right authoritarian society that idolizes military service and especially people who pass "selection" tests.

A 55 story tall megastructure that is home to roughly 50,000 people. Most of the city's other buildings are connected by tunnels, legally built or not. Higher levels of Crescent Center are generally more affluent. Every 10 levels, there is an Atrium, which creates a large open space with balconies on each level overlooking an artificial garden. This stratifies each group of 10 levels together - an Atrium on 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. The Level 50 Atrium is ludicrously opulent, Level 0 is largely uninhabitable.

The headquarters of Vextros. It's located on a hillside overlooking Libertas. Huge air and water purification systems keep the corporate campus pristine and habitable outdoors except in extreme conditions.
A nuclear wasteland that is uninhabitable for more than a few hours at a time. It is the result of a lab explosion at Sunset Laboratories.

npcs.name: Alan Carlsile
npcs.description: 123 year old CEO of Vextros. He is the only person who knows about Sunset. He has been trying to undo Scramble so that the city can escape isolation. He wants Sunset to be dismantled more than anything else, and considers it to a threat to humanity. He is often regarded by others as a sociopath, but it's more accurate to say that he's singularly focused on undoing Regina's mistake, and isn't concerned with anything else.

profile.narrative_summary: A grungy, 27 year old woman with a grudge against Vextros.

arc-root-echoes-shattered-tower.title: Within the shadowed expanse of Crescent Center's 20th Atrium, Sierra Violet confronts a distraught community leader whose urgent words reveal the destabilization of the vital communication tower. A tense crowd murmurs anxiously as faction representatives exchange wary glances. Sierra’s grudge against Vextros sharpens her resolve as she learns beneath the fragile surface of diplomatic talks lurk corporate sabotage and forbidden experiments. The strained alliances teeter on collapse unless she deftly navigates this dangerous web.
arc-root-echoes-shattered-tower.description: Within the shadowed expanse of Crescent Center's 20th Atrium, Sierra Violet confronts a distraught community leader whose urgent words reveal the destabilization of the vital communication tower. A tense crowd murmurs anxiously as faction representatives exchange wary glances. Sierra’s grudge against Vextros sharpens her resolve as she learns beneath the fragile surface of diplomatic talks lurk corporate sabotage and forbidden experiments. The strained alliances teeter on collapse unless she deftly navigates this dangerous web.

choices.text: Agree to investigate the tower’s failure, requesting more details about recent events.
choices.dialogue_response: You have my attention. Tell me everything you know about this failure—who found it first, and what evidence points to sabotage?
choices.player_perspective: Leena nods, her face tense but relieved. "Patrols noticed unusual data spikes three nights ago. Then the system went dark hours later. No one’s had full access to the logs since—Vextros locked them tight. I managed to snag a partial report before the lockdown."
choices.body_language: You lean in slightly, eyes fixed steadily, signaling serious intent.
choices.internal_hint: Begin the investigation by engaging a faction insider to learn initial intel.
choices.internal_justification: Starting player's involvement through a trusted faction member enables exposition and sets the investigation path.

choices.text: Call out the Vextros envoy directly, accusing them of sabotage given your grudge.
choices.dialogue_response: Cut the lies. With my history, I know this stinks of Vextros' dirty tricks. What are you hiding?
choices.player_perspective: The envoy’s smirk fades into a controlled sneer. "Bold words, Sierra. Remember who holds the city’s pulse. Your grudge blinds you—be careful where you point those accusations."
choices.body_language: You glare steadily, fists clenched subtly at your sides, voice edged with scorn.
choices.internal_hint: Increase tension with Vextros and reveal faction hostility.
choices.internal_justification: Utilizing player’s grudge enables personal stakes and heightens faction conflict early on.

choices.text: Appeal to Leena for Open Blocks’ resources to access restricted tower areas.
choices.dialogue_response: If I’m going in blind, I’ll need more than intuition. Can the Open Blocks cover my back in these tunnels?
choices.player_perspective: Leena’s eyes narrow thoughtfully. "We can send a liaison team—but you’ll have to earn their trust. Many suspect spies everywhere." She slides you a discreet data shard. "This has partial schematics; it’ll help you navigate the lower levels."
choices.body_language: You accept the shard with a nod, fingers tightening slightly in a silent promise.
choices.internal_hint: Establish alliance with Open Blocks for support within their territory.
choices.internal_justification: Allowing player to gain faction allies encourages complex social dynamics and varied gameplay approaches.

choices.text: Remain silent and watch the Vextros envoy closely, probing for hints of deception.
choices.player_perspective: You narrow your eyes, reading every twitch of the envoy’s lips and subtle shifts in posture. His polished demeanor barely masks the faint twitch on his left hand, a telltale sign of stress or a concealed implant signal. Something’s off.
choices.body_language: You keep your posture relaxed but alert, occasionally tilting your head in subtle inquiry.

attributes_gained.description: Recognized nervous microexpressions on the Vextros envoy, indicating possible deception.

choices.internal_hint: Enable discovery of Vextros envoy’s subtle signs of stress to open new dialogue paths.
choices.internal_justification: Building narrative depth by noticing NPC behavior allows diversified player strategies.

choices.text: Show weary frustration at the imploding situation and risk of all-out conflict.
choices.dialogue_response: Every thread I pull just tangles the city tighter. How do we stop this before it all collapses?
choices.player_perspective: Leena’s expression softens slightly, mirroring your exhaustion. "We hold the fragile line—barely. But someone with your fire might tip the balance. Just don’t lose yourself in the shadows."
choices.body_language: You lower your gaze briefly, voice dropping before steeling with renewed focus.
choices.internal_hint: Introduce emotional stakes and motivate player determination.
choices.internal_justification: Conveys high personal risk and narrative weight, deepening immersion and player commitment.

consequences.express-distrust-vextros: Tensions with Vextros escalate, increasing faction scrutiny on the player.
consequences.seek-open-blocks-support: Player secures limited access and aides from Open Blocks, increasing faction cooperation.
consequences.observe-vextros-envoy-silently: Player gains insight into envoy’s nervousness, opening new dialogue routes.
consequences.express-resigned-frustration: Player’s emotional vulnerability creates trust with Leena but risks reduced morale.

arc-shadowed-huddle-whispers.title: In a dim corner of the 20th Atrium, Sierra and Leena draw away from the crowd. Leena lowers her voice, eyes darting nervously while glancing over her shoulder. She pulls a shimmer-thin data shard from her coat and offers it to you with a grave expression.
arc-shadowed-huddle-whispers.description: In a dim corner of the 20th Atrium, Sierra and Leena draw away from the crowd. Leena lowers her voice, eyes darting nervously while glancing over her shoulder. She pulls a shimmer-thin data shard from her coat and offers it to you with a grave expression.

choices.text: Accept the data shard with gratitude, tucking it away carefully.
choices.dialogue_response: \"Thank you, Leena. I’ll keep this as close as I keep my own skin.\" "
choices.player_perspective: You palm the shard carefully, a sharp intake of breath from shared danger. Leena’s relieved nod hints at hesitant trust forming.
choices.body_language: You take the shard gently, fingers brushing hers briefly in silent gratitude.
choices.internal_hint: Player accepts secret data shard, signaling trust with Open Blocks.
choices.internal_justification: Allows player access to secret communications, advancing the plot and faction relations.

choices.text: Lower your voice too and press Leena cautiously about the shard's origin and risk.
choices.dialogue_response: "Who’s behind the chatter? And why risk your neck with this?"
choices.player_perspective: Leena’s eyes narrow, weighing how much to reveal. "Open Blocks have rumors, whispers of deeper Project Sunset ties. But even among us, no one’s sure yet. We fear the worse."
choices.body_language: You lean forward slightly, voice low, gaze steady and searching.
choices.internal_hint: Press NPC for deeper information about data shard.
choices.internal_justification: Builds player's insight into the stakes and tailors next steps.

choices.text: Step back politely, expressing reluctance to carry such dangerous proof right now.
choices.dialogue_response: "I can’t take this on at the moment. Too risky, too much heat."
choices.player_perspective: Leena’s mouth tightens for a moment before she nods. "Understood. Just know the city’s fraying. This shard might be the thread or the fuse."
choices.body_language: You hold your hands open briefly, palms outward in a gentle refusal.
choices.internal_hint: Allow player to opt out of immediate burden of secret data.
choices.internal_justification: Preserves player agency and allows narrative breathing room.

consequences.accept-shard-gratefully: Player trusts Open Blocks, gaining access to covert communications.
consequences.question-leena-cautiously: Player gains nuanced intel on Project Sunset rumors.
consequences.decline-shard-politely: Player avoids immediate risk, but loses chance to advance secret intel.

arc-envoy-subtle-challenge.title: The Vextros envoy shifts his weight, gaze icy but attempting casual charm as he steps closer. His words drip with thinly veiled threat wrapped in seeming diplomacy.
arc-envoy-subtle-challenge.description: The Vextros envoy shifts his weight, gaze icy but attempting casual charm as he steps closer. His words drip with thinly veiled threat wrapped in seeming diplomacy.

choices.text: Meet his gaze steadily. "I’m prepared to pay any price if it means exposing Vextros’ corruption."
choices.dialogue_response: "I’m prepared to pay any price if it means exposing Vextros’ corruption."
choices.player_perspective: His smile tightens, a flicker of respect or annoyance sparking in his eyes. "Bold words, but dangerous. Choose carefully."
choices.body_language: You hold your posture firm, chin raised, eyes locked on his.
choices.internal_hint: Player asserts defiance fueling faction tension.
choices.internal_justification: Reflects player’s grudge and heightens interpersonal conflict.

choices.text: Lower your voice, sliding a hint of caution into your tone. "Maybe there’s common ground to stabilize the city, if we act together."
choices.dialogue_response: "Maybe there’s common ground to stabilize the city, if we act together."
choices.player_perspective: The envoy’s eyes narrow briefly, calculating. "I’ll take that as a start, Sierra. Just don’t cross the line."
choices.body_language: You relax your stance slightly, offering a subtle nod.
choices.internal_hint: Player attempts diplomatic engagement to manage tensions.
choices.internal_justification: Allows varied player approaches through social nuance.

choices.text: Eyes narrowing, respond with a cutting question: "Are you so certain Vextros *wants* stability, or only control?"
choices.dialogue_response: "Are you so certain Vextros *wants* stability, or only control?"
choices.player_perspective: His grin twists into a mocking sneer. "Careful, Sierra, or you’ll find out how deep loyalty runs with consequences hard to face."
choices.body_language: You lean in slightly, voice low and challenging.
choices.internal_hint: Player pushes envoy with statements that question Vextros’ motives.
choices.internal_justification: Deepens factional distrust and dramatic tension.

consequences.reply-with-calm-defiance: Envoy becomes wary and more watchful; personal stakes rise.
consequences.feign-caution-and-cooperation: Envoy cautiously reconsiders, opening narrow window for truce.
consequences.sharp-retort-question-his-loyalty: Envoy escalates tension and issues subtle threat.

arc-open-blocks-liaison-doubt.title: Your request for Open Blocks’ support is met with cautious skepticism by Lia, the liaison officer assigned to you. She studies your face closely, voice laced with suspicion and weary experience.
arc-open-blocks-liaison-doubt.description: Your request for Open Blocks’ support is met with cautious skepticism by Lia, the liaison officer assigned to you. She studies your face closely, voice laced with suspicion and weary experience.

choices.text: Look her directly in the eye. "My grudge against Vextros drives me to protect what’s left. I have no interest in harm to Open Blocks."
choices.dialogue_response: "My grudge against Vextros drives me to protect what’s left. I have no interest in harm to Open Blocks."
choices.player_perspective: Lia’s gaze softens just a little, a flicker of respect passing through. "Good. Actions speak louder, Sierra. Let's hope yours shout louder than words."
choices.body_language: Your stance relaxes, shoulders squared and unyielding.
choices.internal_hint: Build initial trust with Open Blocks via alignment of motivations.
choices.internal_justification: Leverages player’s grudge to build faction relationships.

choices.text: Flash a quick, dry smile. "If I were trustworthy, I wouldn’t be standing in this warren right now, would I?"
choices.dialogue_response: "If I were trustworthy, I wouldn’t be standing in this warren right now, would I?"
choices.player_perspective: Lia’s lips twitch into the hint of a smirk, but her guard remains. "Funny, but funny may not be enough. Keep talking."
choices.body_language: You lean lightly against the wall, arms loosely crossed.
choices.internal_hint: Diffuse tension with humor to open dialogue.
choices.internal_justification: Varied player style encourages social dynamics.

choices.text: Narrow eyes and bite back: "Better an outsider with a grudge than a traitor with a badge. We both know who bleeds the city dry."
choices.dialogue_response: "Better an outsider with a grudge than a traitor with a badge. We both know who bleeds the city dry."
choices.player_perspective: Lia’s jaw tightens, but respect flashes beneath the surface. "Point taken. But talk is cheap here—prove it."
choices.body_language: You lean forward, voice low and steady.
choices.internal_hint: Escalate tension with faction by owning player’s attitude.
choices.internal_justification: Highlights gritty, anarchistic faction dynamics.

consequences.deflect-with-humor: Breaks initial ice, keeps door open for alliance.
consequences.challenge-her-skepticism-directly: Raises tension, requiring proof of loyalty.

arc-envoy-silence-tension.title: During the fraught conversation, the Vextros envoy suddenly pauses, his gaze locking with yours. The ambient noise dims as he weighs his next words carefully.
arc-envoy-silence-tension.description: During the fraught conversation, the Vextros envoy suddenly pauses, his gaze locking with yours. The ambient noise dims as he weighs his next words carefully.

choices.text: Meet his challenge unabashedly. "I’ve carried heavier burdens. Let the city burn, but I won’t let silence bury the truth."
choices.dialogue_response: "I’ve carried heavier burdens. Let the city burn, but I won’t let silence bury the truth."
choices.player_perspective: His eyes flare briefly, the faintest hint of grudging respect. "Bold. Careful you don’t drown in that fire you light."
choices.body_language: You keep your stance firm, unwavering eye contact.
choices.internal_hint: Player embraces risks to confront faction power.
choices.internal_justification: Elevates tension and personal stakes.

choices.text: Exhale slowly, lowering your tone. "I don’t seek needless destruction. But if truths die, so does hope."
choices.dialogue_response: "I don’t seek needless destruction. But if truths die, so does hope."
choices.player_perspective: His gaze softens just enough to hint at a complicated understanding. "Words of a fool or a prophet—I hope you’re the latter."
choices.body_language: You soften your expression, brief pause in stance.
choices.internal_hint: Player tempers willingness for conflict with caution.
choices.internal_justification: Adds complexity to player character and faction interaction.

choices.text: Hold his gaze silently, withholding words but letting conviction speak.
choices.player_perspective: The envoy’s brow furrows beneath his practiced facade, uncertainty flickering. The moment taut, heavy with unspoken threats and challenges.
choices.body_language: You lean forward, eyes unblinking and steady in silent defiance.

"Trust here isn’t given, it’s earned. Before we send you with our people, I need to know—can you handle yourself when the city’s darkest comes knocking?"
arc-open-blocks-trust-test.description: Lia leans forward casually but eyes you with sharp intent, producing a battered holo-sidearm from her jacket and setting it on the table. "Trust here isn’t given, it’s earned. Before we send you with our people, I need to know—can you handle yourself when the city’s darkest comes knocking?"

choices.text: "Try me. I’m no stranger to shadows or scars."
choices.dialogue_response: "Try me. I’m no stranger to shadows or scars."
choices.player_perspective: A dry smile cracks Lia’s face. "Good. The city’s no place for the faint-hearted. Welcome to the front lines."
choices.body_language: You square your shoulders, voice even and steady.

attributes_gained.description: Gained tentative ally status with the Open Blocks liaison.

choices.internal_hint: Player demonstrates readiness and toughness to earn trust.
choices.internal_justification: Ties narrative progress to player’s grit and prowess.

choices.text: "I’m not invincible, Lia. But my cause is worth the risk."
choices.dialogue_response: "I’m not invincible, Lia. But my cause is worth the risk."
choices.player_perspective: Lia’s eyes soften with the weight of experience. "That kind of honesty might save you yet. We’ll watch your back."
choices.body_language: You lower your gaze briefly before meeting hers anew.

attributes_gained.description: Open Blocks watch you cautiously, willing to lend some support.

choices.internal_hint: Player’s vulnerability yields cautious faction support.
choices.internal_justification: Offers alternate social approach to alliance-building.

choices.text: "If the city’s darkness scares you, maybe you’re in the wrong fight."
choices.dialogue_response: "If the city’s darkness scares you, maybe you’re in the wrong fight."
choices.player_perspective: Lia studies you with a flicker of something like respect—and a warning. "Sharp tongue can cut both ways, Sierra. Don’t cut the wrong one."
choices.body_language: You cross your arms tightly, jaw clenched.
choices.internal_hint: Escalate tension through assertive aggression.
